title: Building Systems that Last: The Future of Sustainable Institutions
description: The JPI Impact Conference (Adamawa State Chapter) brings together visionary leaders, innovators, and changemakers under the theme 'Built To Last' to explore how individuals and institutions can build enduring impact. Daniel Ishaku, CEO of Toko Academy, will deliver a keynote on 'Building Systems that Last: The Future of Sustainable Institutions,' sharing insights on designing scalable, human-centered systems, fostering innovation, and leading with purpose to create lasting impact.

title: The Future of Web Development
description: Exploring emerging trends: AI-assisted development, edge runtimes, component-driven design systems, and sustainable coding practices.

title: Securing Serverless and Edge Architectures
description: Best practices for securing distributed serverless workloads, identity, secrets rotation, and runtime observability.

title: Sustainable Open Source Leadership
description: Maintaining healthy communities, funding models, contributor onboarding, and documentation excellence for OSS projects.
